meanings.definition: A line drawn under a word or phrase for emphasis.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used _underscores_ to highlight the key points in the text.
meanings.sent2: In the book, the author used _underscores_ to draw attention to important terms.
meanings.sent3: The _underscores_ in the document made it easier for the students to identify the main ideas.
meanings.sent4: The _underscores_ acted like a spotlight, shining on the crucial information.
meanings.sent5: The bright red _underscores_ made the words stand out on the page.

meanings.sent1: She carefully _underscores_ the key points in her presentation.
meanings.sent2: His actions _underscores_ the importance of teamwork in this project.
meanings.sent3: The comedian cleverly _underscores_ the absurdity of everyday situations in his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The music _underscores_ the emotional intensity of the scene in the movie.
meanings.sent5: The sudden silence _underscores_ the tension in the room.
